title: fSpy camera parameters
description:
Camera parameters exported by the fSpy application

> Camera matching, or camera calibration, is the process of estimating camera parameters from certain features in an image. fSpy computes the approximate focal length, orientation and position of the camera in 3D space based on user defined control points in still images. The computed camera parameters can be used in other apps, for example 3D modeling tools.

Read more at https://fspy.io/basics/.

cameraTransform.title: Camera transform matrix
cameraTransform.description: An homographic matrix that represent the camera matrix: position, rotation, scale.

rows.title: Matrix rows
rows.description: Four rows, each with four elements. They correspond to the [row-major order](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Row-_and_column-major_order#Column-major_order)

items.title: Matrix row
items.description: A matrix row, with four elements

imageWidth.title: Image width
imageWidth.description: The width in pixels of the image (or still video frame) used to caracterize the camera position.

imageHeight.title: Image height
imageHeight.description: The height in pixels of the image (or still video frame) used to caracterize the camera position.

principalPoint.title: Principal point
principalPoint.description:
> Imagine a ray going straight through the middle of a cameraâ€™s lens. The point where this ray hits the sensor (or film) is the principal point. This point usually coincides with the midpoint of the image. In some cases, for example if an image has been asymmetrically cropped, the principal point might be somewhere else.

See more at https://fspy.io/tutorial/#principal-point.

It corresponds to a point in the image : -1 corresponds to the left or top, 0 corresponds to the middle, while 1 corresponds to the right or bottom.

x.title: Horizontal coordinate
x.description: The horizontal coordinate of the principal point on the image, between -1 (left) and 1 (right), 0 being the center.

y.title: Vertical coordinate
y.description: The vertical coordinate of the principal point on the image, between -1 (top) and 1 (bottom), 0 being the center.

horizontalFieldOfView.title: Horizontal field of view
horizontalFieldOfView.description: The image width expressed in radians. The principal point corresponds to `0` radians, and the image left is `-horizontalFieldOfView/2` radians while the image right is `horizontalFieldOfView/2` radians

verticalFieldOfView.title: Vertical field of view
verticalFieldOfView.description: The image height expressed in radians. The principal point corresponds to `0` radians, and the image top is `-verticalFieldOfView/2` radians while the image bottom is `verticalFieldOfView/2` radians. Note that the aspect ratio between horizontalFieldOfView and verticalFieldOfView is the same as between imageWidth and imageHeight.
